Row.Text: A Brazilwood Camp can only be built on Jungle and Forest tiles. It provides additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. After the Machinery technology is researched it also provides extra [ICON_GOLD] Gold, after the Acoustics technology is researched it provides extra [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and after the Industrialization tehchnology is researches it provides extra production.

Brazilwood is a tropical hardwood whose bark produces a bright crimson and deep purple extract used in dyes. Its wood is dense, and is prized for crafting stringed instruments (especially the bows) and cabinetry. The harvesting of brazilwood did not cease until 1875, by which time synthetic dyes dominated the textile industry and other hardwoods had been found to be better for musical instruments.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A Brazilwood Camp can only be built on Jungle and Forrest tiles, and will also generate +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold once Machinery is researched, +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Acoustics is researched, and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production once Industrilaztion is researched.
